revised_title: Initiation and Growth of Explosion in Solids: Part I - Structure and Stability of Inorganic Azides
tldr: The authors discuss the initiation and growth of explosions in solids, focusing on the structure and stability of inorganic azides. They explore the relationship between the ionization potential of the metal atom and the azide's explosive properties, as well as the role of heat in initiating explosions. The study highlights the importance of understanding the differences in bonding and decomposition mechanisms between inorganic azides and organic azides.
